problem.markdown:
>>What is the greenhouse gas with the highest global warming potential?<< () Carbon dioxide (x) CFCs () Nitrous oxide () Methane () Water vapour
[explanation] CFCs, or chlorofluorocarbons, are made by humans for use in refrigerators and air conditioners. Their global warming potential varies widely, from 1500 to over 10,000. [explanation]
